intro: Ardisia smaragdinoides, commonly known as the emerald gem or jewel ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are attractive to birds, aiding in seed dispersal. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and evergreen foliage. Ardisia smaragdinoides prefers shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for woodland gardens.
